LAS401H1-Y-20175.courseDescription: A historical survey of migration from Latin American countries to Canada, this course examines mediation strategies of Latinos as they adjust to a new home: negotiation of national identities, political participation, entrepreneurship, cultural representations, and charitable work. Students engage in service with organization working with/in LatAm communities.
LAS401H1-Y-20175.prerequisite: LAS200H1, LAS201H1, one LAS 300-level course, interview
LAS401H1-Y-20175.recommendedPreparation: JQR360: The Canadian Census: Populations, Migrations, and Demographics
LAS401H1-Y-20175.webTimetableInstructions: If you do not have all the pre-requisites for this course, but are interested in taking it, please email las.coord@utoronto.ca. This course has a service-learning component: students are expected to complete a placement with a community partner organization that will take approx. 2 hours a week, or 25 hours in total, during the May to August Summer period. Scheduling of the placement hours will be mutually agreed by the student and the community partner.
